text: Finn Ludvig Seemann (18 October 1944 – 7 September 1985) was a Norwegian footballer who played as a striker. Seemann was born in Oslo. He started his football career in Lyn, where he became league champion in 1964. In 1965, he became professional in the Scottish club Dundee United. After two seasons in Scotland he went to the Netherlands, where he played for DWS and FC Utrecht, and also lived in the United States in a period before he returned to Lyn in 1975. He has also played in Vålerenga, Sarpsborg and Bækkelaget. He was capped 15 times and scored four goals for Norway. Seemann was also capped three times for Norway in bandy. He appeared in pre-season games as a placekicker for the Houston Oilers in 1973 and 1974. He died in a car accident in 1985, on the E6 highway near Dovre. ==References== Category:Norwegian footballers Category:1944 births Category:1985 deaths Category:Sportspeople from Oslo Category:Association football forwards Category:Lyn Fotball players Category:Dundee United F.C. players Category:AFC DWS players Category:FC Utrecht players Category:Vålerenga Fotball players Category:Sarpsborg FK players Category:Eredivisie players Category:Norway international footballers Category:Norwegian expatriate footballers Category:Expatriate footballers in Scotland Category:Expatriate footballers in the Netherlands Category:Norwegian expatriate sportspeople in Scotland Category:Norwegian expatriate sportspeople in the Netherlands Category:Norwegian expatriate sportspeople in the United Kingdom Category:Norwegian bandy players Category:Road incident deaths in Norway Category:American football placekickers Category:Footballers who switched code Category:Norwegian players of American football Category:Houston Oilers players
title: Finn Seemann
